scope.narrative: DG EuropeAid, which is 75% of Commission ODA. Data not (yet) captured: ODA from DG Enlargement, EIB and ECHO

publication-timetable.narrative:
1. November 2011: Publication of the IATI standard phase 1 on available quantitative and qualitative data through the IATI registry and EuropeAid website
2. December 2011 at High Level forum IV: Presentation of the IATI standard phase 1 to the participants of the Forum including presentation of the user friendly, accessible and visual presentation by TR-AID
3. December 2012: Publication of the phase 2 additional data of the IATI standard

publication-frequency.narrative: Quarterly basis. The IATI reporting will be limited to new decisions from 2010 onwards.

publication-lifecycle.narrative: From the implementation phase onwards and covering the evaluation and closure of a project.

data-quality.narrative: Data quality will not be an issue providing that: 1) the scope remains limited to Decisions from 2010 onwards 2) a solution is thought through and implemented in CRIS (IT tool) for the few decisions with multiple projects identified before the reporting deadline

approach.narrative: IATI implementation is taken up in the IT implementation schedule Schema Directeur. By 31 March 2011 a working group will be set up for implementation and monitoring.

license.narrative:
As the Commission has its own re-use policy for its own information, and because we already publish all the information and third parties can use it, we should adhere to this and not opt for any of the various open licensing initiatives that are currently available.
Please keep in mind that while in former days the use of the information was restricted, nowadays the Commission is already following an open approach.
Such is indicated at the current legal notice "Reproduction is authorised, provided the source is acknowledged, save where otherwise stated." http://ec.europa.eu/geninfo/legal_notices_en.htm
Additionally, this would avoid any further problems and will avoid granting rights to third parties who could later claim further rights.

activity-multilevel.narrative: The activity will be in principle defined at the level of the projects. There are multi-projects structures, as for example the call for proposals for thematic budget lines. In the latter case If possible for each grant contract some information could be also published once the contract is signed â€“ information related to DAC form will be excluded at the level of contract (Confirmation has been requested on this point to IATI in order to avoid double counting).

segmentation.narrative: This is technically feasible providing that a clear definition is given for the country field.

user-interface.narrative: The TR-AID database of the EC Joint Research Centre will be used for this purpose

total-budget.notes: Total development budget for each of the next three years.

recipient-org-budget.notes: The budget of the next three years for each institution (i.e. Multilateral organisation, NGOs, foundations and others) that receive core funding from the donors.

recipient-country-budget.notes: Field not available in the system. Since item is phase 2 further exploration in 2011-2012.

document-link.notes: End of 2011 before HLF IV: already published (and other available) documents. End of 2012: other documents for phase 2.

title.notes: Most of the titles are in EN or FR except SP for Latin America countries.
Most of the titles are in EN or FR except SP for Latin America countries.

description.notes: Most of the descriptions are in EN or FR except SP for Latin America countries.
Most of the descriptions are in EN or FR except SP for Latin America countries.

activity-date.notes: Reporting will be limited to expected dates as OECD definition. At the moment, not possible to provide actual dates.
Reporting will be limited to expected dates as OECD definition. At the moment, not possible to provide actual dates.

contact-info.notes: Not applicable. As regards protection of data, the European Commission does not disclose any personal data such as names or details of contact persons.

participating-org.notes: Definitions not clear for this item, field not available as such. To be further explored in 2011-2012.

location.notes: Field not available in the system. Since item is phase 2 and optional further exploration in 2011-2012.

sector.notes: Not applicable. Reporting limited to OECD official definition.

policy-marker.notes: Limited to official OECD markers and definitions.

default-aid-type.provider-definition: OECD Aid type (A01 = General budget support, A02 = Sector Budget...)

default-tied-status.notes: Field not yet available. To be explored in 2011.

budget.notes: Field not available in the system. Since item is phase 2 further exploration in 2011-2012.

planned-disbursement.notes: Field not available in the system. Since item is phase 2 further exploration in 2011-2012.

transaction.notes: Field not available in the system. Since item is phase 2 further exploration in 2011-2012.
Definitions not clear for this item. Need further work with IATI. In principle, field not available as such.
Not applicable to EDF and Budget.

document-link.notes: End of 2011 before HLF IV: already published (and other available) documents. End of 2012: other documents for phase 2.

activity-website.notes: Not systematically implemented. To be explored in 2011.

related-activity.notes: Link between decision (parent) and contracts (child) to be clarified with IATI for multi-projects (call for proposals thematic budget lines).

conditions.notes: General conditions of the Financing Agreements need to include a provision stating that both parties agree to the publication of the Financing Agreement. As soon as the modification is in force, the EC will ensure the systematic publication on EuropeAid's website.
Field not yet available in the system. Since item is phase 2 and optional further exploration in 2011-2012.

result.notes: Field not yet available in the system. Since item is phase 2 and optional further exploration in 2011-2012.
